title: The Great Exchange
outcome: The Council orchestrates a citywide 'Peace Exchange,' requiring districts to swap their chosen civic values—like safety and freedom—for two weeks. Residents struggle with enforced new norms, reliving past behavioral experiments. The supposed unity campaign deepens fractures when people refuse to revert, magnifying tensions and sparking distrust toward authority. Temporary calm masks a city on the edge.

events.description: The Council announces a two-week 'Peace Exchange,' mandating districts to swap civic value priorities and live under new norms as a unity experiment.
Unrest grows as residents resist rapid changes—safety districts experience protests over sudden loss of freedoms; freedom districts struggle under new rules and restrictions.
Council-appointed monitors conduct visible evaluations in neighborhoods, but their presence increases suspicion and reports of subtle system bias in BCI adjustment.
As the 'Peace Exchange' ends, many citizens refuse to revert to original values, fracturing some districts and sparking debates about permanent change.
Council meetings reveal heightened factional divisions as they struggle to adapt policies to the new map of fractured civic allegiances—the city's calm now visibly fragile.
